title: And what would you do if... ?
content:
DISCLAIMER: I have no intention on starting another "the PCKF is dying" flamewar. This might accidentally start a "the PCKF needs a new host" flamewar, but nothing more.
- Shadow Master, a.k.a. "shadow"
[hr]
I wanted to ask this a lot of time ago, and after seeing how someone can ask such a question in a hyperactive forum, and get some funny constructive comments in exchange, well... here it goes...

Q: Let's suppose the worst, that Chogall (AFAIK, the only maintainer of PCKF's EzBoard subscription), for some reason couldn't continue/stopped paying the sub and the PCKF disappears. What would you do? (I hope that never will happen, btw) Or what would you do if another EzBoard attack occurs and our community is seriously affected?

Just two simple questions. It's the admins' and moderator's decision to delete/lock this thread if this causes a flamewar.
[hr]
And I answer...

A: Perhaps I'd slowly forget about making Keen mods (but that's what K:M is for [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ) and start making stuff for newer games, in my spare time (and it'll be small this year). Or I'd put more effort in writing a Keen-style (tm) game engine.
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img]
Hey, might be the answer to the second question maybe "we'd better move to yuku, or some phpbb based board".[hr]SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: And what would you do if... ?
content:
The second wouldn't affect me much, I'd just keep going on like before. If the first happened, I'd contact some Keeners and we'd put it back online to some other place, and probably with phpBB or something. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: And what would you do if... ?
content: Yeah, the next time something majorly screws up here, a bunch of us Keeners across various IM networks would form a new solution and try to setup a new PCKF somewhere else. It's tempting to do so already, but apparently Cho'gall has plans. I just hope they happen soon.

title: Re: And what would you do if... ?
content:
Bah, we've been "planning to move" for years now - bring on the phpbb already!

Seriously though, if this forum went down the problem would be whose forum to switch to, because half the keen community would put up replacements all over the place [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: And what would you do if... ?
content:
I always thought that if Chogal stopped paying that the only thing that would happen is that we would be flooded by adds.

[quote]Quote:[hr]It's tempting to do so already, but apparently Cho'gall has plans. I just hope they happen soon. [hr][/quote]

I seriously have a hard time to believe that there are still people who think that Chogall or even eK would do anything for this community. After all these years.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: And what would you do if... ?
content:
Not those of us with AdBlock or similar devices.

[hr]Djaser I seriously have a hard time to believe that there are still people who think that Chogall or even eK would do anything for this community. After all these years.
[hr]As do I, but KeenRush contacted him about the matter on the snobministration forum and Cho'gall replied that he wants to do something at CC314 eventually. At this stage, beating him to the punch would probably divide the community too much, so for now it looks like we sweat it out with ezBoard.

title: Re: And what would you do if... ?
content:
If the PCKF dies, I'd buy the domain and set up a new forum on it. Maybe. Or someone else would. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

content:

title: Re: And what would you do if... ?
content:
Djaser wrote:
Yah stuff like that keeps you busy all day that's why I also never visit this place anymore.

Um, but I think you can get 5 minutes of spare time every 5 months, and that would be enough to say "Hey, I'm alive!". [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] It seems that Chogall appears every 2 years here. This year I'll be studying in a university too, I won't have time for mods, but I'm sure I'll be able to check the forums every 2 months at least. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

BTW [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] I'm no native english speaker, so I shouldn't ask, but what's that of "I never visit this place anymore"???

...

Considering my point, the admins have been very inactive lately, except for KeenRush (who posts and reads) and xtraverse (who only reads... and he also made a level for the K1 level competition). It looks like they (chogall, eK and Yorpy) abandoned the PCKF without a simple announcement ("hey guys, I won't check the forums for 10 years because of my career"). Worse, the only moderator (Snaily) hasn't appeared for a looong time, and again, he didn't leave a message. Yeah, maybe the admins thought that, since this is a very small community, no non-admin moderators are needed, but how come K:M has a non-admin moderator that's (almost) always active (KeenRush), apart from the admins (Andy and Xky)?

If I were the admin, I'd have posted an announcement, that I won't be here for a year or 10, and blah, blah dah dah. We all happy, we know what happens, there's nothing to worry about.

Um... maybe you don't worry about the great admins' inactivity anyway (by great I mean the oldest Keeners and those who control CC314 too).
[hr]SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: And what would you do if... ?
content:
In a place far, far away...

X: So you're the one who finances the Commander Keen community forum.
Cho'gall: Yeah, but I decided to quit financing it this year. I need to invest money for my career, it is way more important than financing a waste of time and money like that community.
X: Oh, do you think so?

(time passes, X is alone)
X: I'd better help'em and finance the community now that Cho'gall has abandoned them.
To be continued...
[hr]
The worst scenario was that, but note that it could be reality. Who can assure that Cho'gall still cares about us?

Hopefully this is not the case, but I'm in comparison to Levellass's dramatic fictional story, this one could be a more realistic dramatic story.

Unless EzBoard only allows the original account owner to pay the subscription, in that case, I'm most likely wrong (hopefully). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] [hr]SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

content:
I think it allows other people to pay too, at least donate money to it.

And, a few months ago he just paid this thing once again..

And last, as said before, even if Cho'gall would find better use for his money, that wouldn't mean any end, as, as said before, many of us could put this thing back up somewhere -- not that everyone would, since spending any money to something web related is out of question for many. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] But one or few would be enough.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

content:
I'd be more than happy to pay for a year's worth of hosting - we'd need to get Cho to switch www.pckf.com over to wherever that would be, but cash isn't an issue.------------------
[url=http://www.szevvy.net]www.szevvy.net[/url], for all your Wombat needs. You know you want to.
A member of the LevelLord fan club.

One day he'll ask himself why he still pays money for something he doesn't care for and stops paying, that will be the moment that we have to move. Apparently everyone is willing to wait for that moment.-----------------

content:
With all respect, some of you make this all sound like the universe was about to toast.. Really, the situation isn't bad, and if something ever happens to this particular ezBoard and no official move happens in time, it's easy to change it somewhere if that's required. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

Xtra, anyways, I'm still too old-fashioned to want even that kind of system, I'd like pure forum without the bells and whistles. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

title: Re: And what would you do if... ?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I'd oppose (or at least, wouldn't like) that integration because I'd like Keen to have a place all of its own (in the future as well), without any other games there. [hr][/quote]
I agree on that, although a place on Xtraverse site wouldn't be that bad because Keen is the only game on that site with a real fan community.

[quote]Quote:[hr]eK is still around it seems, [hr][/quote]
EK still posts occasionally but that doesn't mean at all that he is willing to do anything for the community. I think he would even admit that if asked.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Flaose has returned. [hr][/quote]
To his home yes, not to yet to the community. If he returns, and that's a large if, it wouldn't be reasonable to expect him to do anything soon and I don't think he even would want to.

You're pretty new so in a short summary: most people that are mentioned as admins and moderators on this site, only are so in name. They do not want to play an active role in the community anymore and admit that.-----------------
